abstract: Pres Obama insists seven Iranians accused or convicted of violating American trade sanctions and released in prisoner swap deal had no ties to terrorist activity; calls release 'one-time gesture to Iran,' given unique circumstances.
lead_paragraph: None of the seven Iranians accused or convicted of violating American trade sanctions against Iran were charged with terrorism, President Obama noted.

headline.main: Details of 7 Iranians Granted Clemency in Prisoner Swap
headline.print_headline: Of 7 Iranians Released, None Have Ties to Terrorism, Obama Says

snippet: None of the seven Iranians accused or convicted of violating American trade sanctions against Iran were charged with terrorism, President Obama noted.
